intro: Acer italum var. intermedium, commonly known as the Italian maple, is a deciduous tree native to southern Europe. It is characterized by its ornamental value, featuring palmate leaves that turn vibrant shades of red and yellow in autumn. The plant typically grows to a height of 8–12 meters, with a rounded canopy and smooth, gray bark. It prefers well-drained soils and full sun to partial shade, making it suitable for a variety of garden settings. Its flowering season occurs in early spring, producing small, inconspicuous yellow-green flowers followed by winged seeds.
